title: MO BAR
summary: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore’s popular afternoon tea returns to the newly opened MO BAR. With a seasonal menu changing bi-monthly and personalised service for which Mandarin Oriental is renowned, indulge in a refreshed experience over views of Singapore. While MO BAR offers an inviting atmosphere at night, it transforms into a relaxing space awash in natural daylight during the day. The antique gold geometric patterns inspired by Polynesian tattoos on the ceiling and façade are accentuated alongside the impressive communal table, decked with a selection of TWG Tea products and gourmet gifts that greets guests upon entering. This month’s decadent treats celebrate the vibrant colours and flavours of Christmas. Begin with Berries-infused Tea Jelly with cinnamon red fruit emulsion, followed by a suite of savoury delicacies including Kueh Pie Tee stuffed with red wine cabbage and wagyu short rib, braised for 12 hours to render it tender, and a refined Foie Gras Lollipop studded with pistachio. Also, savour freshly baked Ginger Spiced Orange Candied and Madagascar Vanilla scones accompanied by clotted cream and homemade jams. Conclude the mid-day indulgence with remarkable desserts on a two-tier stand presented on handmade plates by local ceramic studio, Mud Rock. For a touch of elegance, coffee or tea from the 18 new TWG Tea options available is served in white porcelain cups and saucers with a polished gold rim by Legle from France. Afternoon Tea is priced at SGD 48++ per person and SGD 88++ for two persons inclusive of one pot of coffee or TWG tea. SGD 65++ per person inclusive of one cocktail or mocktail. SGD 68++ per person inclusive of one glass of “R" de Ruinart champagne. For restaurant reservations and enquiries, please email mosin-dining@mohg.com or call +65 6885 3500.
openingHours: Opens: Sun-Thu: 11:00-1:00 Fri-Sat & Eve of Public Holiday: 11:00-2:00 Afternoon Tea: 15:00-17:00 Additional Seating (Weekends and Public Holidays): 12:30-14:30 and 15:00 - 17:00

title: Spizza (Jalan Kayu)
summary: Set along Jalan Kayu, Spizza is a gourmet pizzeria that serves delectable Italian cuisine. Apart from enjoying the salads, soups and their signature thin-crusted pizzas, you also have the option of customising your very own meal by choosing from a large selection of toppings and spices. If you don't have the luxury of time to drop by, you'll be delighted to know that they do deliveries. MUST TRIES: Most diners visit this place to enjoy their thin-crusted wood-fired pizzas. Some of the more popular ones that are perfect for sharing with family and friends include the Isabella – which features fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, parma ham and rucola salad – and the Margherita. The latter features buffalo mozzarella, fresh tomatos and fresh basil.

title: Hospoda Microbrewery
summary: Best beer you probably don't know about – Mixed Beer Despite the demise of Prague Microbrewery & Restaurant, drinkers of pure and simple Czech beer don't have to worry about getting their fill. Hospoda – which means "inn" or "pub" in Czech – opened in October 2013 and serves two types of beer, light and dark (from 330ml for $10). They can also pour you a mixed beer 'float' with the two brews (from 330ml for $12). The menu here features some quality drinking food – sausages, grilled duck and prime baby pork ribs.

title: Ash & Elm
summary: Boldly symbolic of wood-fire and glowing embers reduced from searing heat, Ash & Elm is a vibrant restaurant focused on European dining. Set within a striking venue that embraces the spontaneity and energy of a brasserie, Ash & Elm comprises three exciting culinary theatres including a charcuterie and cheese room, wood-fired oven and an open charcoal-grill kitchen. Offering a selection of sharing platters, house-cured and premium meats, as well as sustainably-sourced seafood, primed with the traditional craft of classic wood-fired ovens and charcoal-grill, Ash & Elm prides itself on the use of fine produce sourced from around the world. A medley of classic creations redefined with fresh touches, is complemented by a wine list of over 100 different labels of wines, handpicked from renowned regions. An open dining concept which brings culinary action to life, guests can expect an interactive dining experience at Ash & Elm.
reservationNum: L1 InterContinental Singapore, 80 Middle Road, 188966 View Map

title: Siam Square Mookata (Golden Mile Tower)
summary: THE BUZZ: With eight outlets and counting, Siam Square Mookata is quite possibly the biggest mookata buffet chain on the island. At $29 per person, diners can order almost everything on the a la carte menu, except for pricier items such as scallops, oysters, and smoked duck etc. The pricer items are $2.80 per plate as compared to $1.80 per plate for the standard items on the a la carte menu. Expect offerings such as succulent tiger kind prawns imported directly from Thailand, teriyaki pork neck, their signature homemade chilli sauce, and sometimes special menu items at various outlets such as shishamo, papaya salad, prawn sashimi and so on.

title: Rong Hua Bak Kut Teh (Waterway Point) (榮華肉骨茶)
summary: Rong Hua Bak Kut Teh offers some of the best Chinese Cuisine serving a tantalising collection of dishes that are suitable for family, large groups, catching up with friends and colleagues. From Bak Kut Teh to Kong Bak Pau its extensive menu is reflective of the restaurant’s efforts to cater to every palate. This restaurant is located in Waterway Point along Punggol Central. The originating roots of "Rong Hua Bak Kut Teh" can be traced back all the way to the 1920s, when our founding grandfather, Mr Chua Ah Hua migrated to Singapore or Nanyang in search of a better life and fortune for his family. When Mr Chua arrived in Singapore, Bak Kut Teh was already being served by the Teochews around Char Jung Tao (Clarke Quay).

title: Yi Ke Guan
summary: THE BUZZ: If you enjoy local delights like Mee Siam and Mutton Soup and sumptuously prepared steamboat, Yi Ke Guan is the best restaurant in SG to provide you with this favourite cuisine of Singaporeans. Deliciously and lavishly prepared with a wide range of ingredients and appetizing broth will give you a good reason to have this hearty meal with your family. Avoid the laborious process of preparation, call us now and we will give you and your family a fulfilling lunch or dinner.

title: Brotzeit German Bier Bar & Restaurant (313@Somerset)
summary: The origin of Brotzeit German Bier Bar & Restaurant's name is derived from a popular Bavarian expression that translates to ""bread-time"" (""brot"" means bread, and ""zeit"" means time) - having a small meal to complement a wholesome beer, which fits the culture of Brotzeit German Bier Bar and Restaurant perfectly. The restaurant delivers quality meals in a warm and welcoming environment on the first floor of 313@Somerset.

title: Gattopardo Ristorante di Mare
